page.title: 01Bolton by Bowland and Holden
page.content: This area is situated 7 miles north west of Clitheroe in Lancashire,3 miles off the busy A59 where the roads from Slaidburn,Settle,Hellifield and Gisburn meet.There is one village of Bolton by Bowland and a small hamlet called Holden.There are several farmhouses scattered through the area and a small group of houses in Bolton Park Estate,where there used to be a hall and servant cottages. It is a farming community with no industry,only one village shop,a part time hairdressers and a small wood workshop.It is very quiet and picturesque,a popular place for visitors.The population has decreased during the last 50 years to 263 on the electoral roll as farms have employed fewer workers,and the young people have left to live in the towns.
